summary: User timeline_28 describes dealing with social anxiety and isolation, with increasing engagement in treatment.

posts.text: Thinking about stopping my meds. Life is meaningless I can't see a future for myself Called my psychiatrist first. reached out to my therapist We're trying a different medication instead. I'm being patient with myself
maladaptive_evidence: I can't see a future for myself
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: I feel so alone. I hate myself so much Nobody understands what I'm going through. I haven't showered in a week Decided to join a support group. practiced my coping strategies Met some people who actually get it. I acknowledge my progress
maladaptive_evidence: I haven't showered in a week
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: I'm going to get fired, I know it. Life is meaningless My performance has been terrible. I've been drinking to cope Met with HR about accommodations. asked for support They're being supportive. Recovery is a journey, not a destination
adaptive_evidence: Recovery is a journey, not a destination
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Everything feels impossible. I hate myself so much I'm worthless. I gave up trying Did one small thing today - made my bed. joined a support group Trying to celebrate tiny victories. I'm building a support system
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Another day of feeling terrible. I hate myself so much I'm completely numb Went outside for 10 minutes. reached out for help Called a friend. I'm proud of myself for trying
adaptive_evidence: I'm proud of myself for trying
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Three weeks without self-harming. reached out for help So proud of myself. I'm not giving up Almost slipped up. Life is meaningless But I reached out for help instead. I'm not giving up
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: Starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel. reached out to my therapist Therapy is really helping. Recovery is a journey, not a destination Still have rough days. I'm disgusting But they're getting less frequent. I can't see a future for myself
adaptive_evidence: Recovery is a journey, not a destination
maladaptive_evidence: I can't see a future for myself
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Feeling hopeful for the first time in months. started going to therapy I'm committed to my recovery Had a bad moment yesterday. I have no reason to keep going But I worked through it using my tools. I'm committed to my recovery
maladaptive_evidence: I have no reason to keep going
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: Three weeks without self-harming. went for a walk to clear my head So proud of myself. I acknowledge my progress Almost slipped up. I feel completely hopeless But I reached out for help instead. I acknowledge my progress
adaptive_evidence: went for a walk to clear my head
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: Feel like I don't deserve to be loved. Nothing will ever get better I hurt myself again My partner has been incredibly supportive. started going to therapy Learning to accept help and love. I'm committed to my recovery
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Side effects are awful. I'm a burden to everyone I isolated myself from all my friends Sticking with it because my doctor said it takes time. did some self-care activities Noticing small improvements in my mood. I'm learning to be kinder to myself
adaptive_evidence: I'm learning to be kinder to myself
maladaptive_evidence: I isolated myself from all my friends
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping
